column3:
I believe in practice it never matters, as the added field is in the last
place, and the size of COrphan isn't used. However, it is technically
undefined behaviour I think.

ACK 22970b0

Minor nit: change the comment: COrphan -> COrphanTx.

Looks like main is still not dead:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9269/commits/22970b0537c9b1747ab66760b8d528fb32848262#diff-eb50db371aa7bd12e62a13879bc661f7L25

;-)
nit: Maybe add a comment to the main definition to remind people to update this one? (ugly but...)\n\nutACK.
Alternatively, we could just expose these functions from main.h, and not duplicate them at all...
Would prefer to not expose them from net_processing.h, even if duplicating them is really gross. Would prefer to add a comment instead.
Adding fields to the end is harmless, a lot of software relies on that with ABIs.\n\nBut it makes sense to sync it anyhow, ACK
